Text: Just in case anyone forgets from previous versions, any serial should work but "1" without quotes is always what is used to test so it is the safest bet.
Thanks, works perfectly. Just download the game from the official website.
Patch doesn't work for me.... I get: "Component COMDLG32.OCX or one of it's dependencies not correctly registered" error. Please help.
An OCX file is a component file for vb6. Installing them is easy. Which version of Windows are you using? Vista / 7 and 32 or 64 bit?
same thing happened to me. google it, then download the zip, put the zip in the patch folder. Worked perfectly
Glad you got it working. Enjoy the game!
so the patch worked great, but I cant start a game as it says it can't find the folder to start a game.... any ideas?

scratch that..... install must have fucked up, i reinstalled and it works perfectly
thanks again
Im having the starting game problem. Patch worked but cant start a new game. Any help?
Scratch that as well, had to do a full uninstall
Did you both open the game once before patching so it could do all of the file install stuff?

Thanks for the Patch, nice :)  It gets the game to work, but Im having the same problem as some who say they cant start a new game. It says "cant create folder" whatever you named the new game. 

I installed it 3 times for the same result (and opening the game so the installation files are installed).
Those of you who have had that issue (even if it is fixed now), what OS are you using?
For those having the "Could not create new folder issue" try running the game as admin. right click icon and select run as admin. that should fix it
and thanks for this! it works perfectly!
Component COMDLG32.OCX or one of it's dependencies not correctly registered" error. Please help. ...Running Windows 7
sparker781: http://www.sevenforums.com/bsod-help-support/59463-comdlg32-ocx.html

I have been trying for 3 days how to figure out how to get this to work. I have windows 8 and I keep getting the same Component COMDLG32.OCX or one of it's dependencies not correctly registered.
I installed visual basic 6 and cummalative service pack.  I could really use some direction on what to do from here.
Try the same link I just posted for Windows 7.
I tried that, It didnt work
32 or 64 bit? If you have 64 bit you need to put it in the syswow64 folder. Did you try that as well? Or did you try running it in xp comparability mode?
that worked putting it into that folder..thanks a lot for your help!
You are very welcome.
